sentences.english: When in doubt, set something on fire.
sentences.chinese: 犹疑不决的时候，就便放把火吧。

sentences.english: Patty is hesitant because it may lead to other things.
sentences.chinese: 派蒂感到犹疑，因为这也许会引致其它的事端。

sentences.english: A fritter is made by deep-frying a small portion of batter or …
sentences.chinese: 一犹疑，是由油炸的一小部分连击或者。

sentences.english: But the expressions in your eyes enclosed by the fence-like fake eyelashes are flickering dimly.
sentences.chinese: 但栅栏似的假睫毛圈住的眼波，却暗淡犹疑。

sentences.english: Fix 2 is a comedy, but still reply say don yd¡ 't want light a person.
sentences.chinese: 修二固然犹疑了一下，但还是答复说不想让光一个人。

sentences.english: "I didn't hesitate much when I started to believe in Jesus, despite my usual skepticism," he said.
sentences.chinese: 抛弃一贯的怀疑论，我毫不犹疑地开始信仰耶稣。

sentences.english: The white show hesitates, but listens to harm Xiao"the half engraves backward the granite bridge see".

sentences.english: Mr. Williams said that he was taken aback by the request and demurred.
sentences.chinese: 威廉姆斯说，他被这个请求吓到了，并且有些犹疑。

sentences.english: There is little room for doubt in a definitive statement.
sentences.chinese: 表示了决心，就没有犹疑的余地了。

sentences.english: The quick Lang seems to be some to hesitate ground to soliloquize.

definition: anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
to oscillate without pause (idiom)/to fluctuate/(of thoughts) to wander/to waver
to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
